sourcesContent:
export const questionObj = {"Qtext": "

Suppose triangle WXY is a right angled triangle with right angle at vertex W and WZ is perpendicular to XY . If \(XY = 14 \) cm, and \(WY = 11 \) cm, then find the ratio of the areas of triangles WXY and ZWY .
\newline
tikzpicture{}
\newline

", "Steps": [{"id": "s1", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "In triangles WXY and ZWY , we have
\[
	\angle X\input[s1v1]{}Y = \angle WZY 
\]
\[
	\angle WYX = \angle W\input[s1v2]{}Z 
\]"}, {"id": "s2", "n_params": 3, "step_txt": "So, we can write that
\[
	\Delta \input[s2v1]{}\input[s2v2]{}\input[s2v3]{} \sim \Delta ZWY 
\]"}, {"id": "s3", "n_params": 2, "step_txt": "
So, now we can write that
\[
	\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta WXY }{\textrm{area of } \Delta ZWY } = \frac{XY ^2 }{WY ^2 } = \frac{\input[s3v1]{} }{\input[s3v2]{} }
\]
\newline
"}]} 

 export const resp = [{"data": ["W", "Y"], "text": "$$\text{Since, both $\angle XWY$ and $\angle WZY$, are right angles, and $\angle WYX = \angle WYZ$, as they are same angles.}$$"}, {"data": ["W", "X", "Y"], "text": " "}, {"data": [196, 121], "text": "$$\text{Since, both triangles are similar and the ratio of similar triangles is equal to the square of the ratio of their corresponding sides. Therefore, $\frac{\textrm{area of } \Delta WXY }{\textrm{area of } \Delta ZWY } = \frac{XY ^2 }{WY ^2 } = \frac{196 }{121 }$}$$"}]
